articles.title: We may well be able to eliminate coronavirus, but we’ll probably never eradicate it. Here’s the difference - Micky News
articles.description: Compared to many other countries around the world, Australia and New Zealand have done an exceptional job controlling COVID-19. As of May 7, there were 794 active cases of COVID-19 in Australia. Only 62 were in hospital. The situation in New Zealand is simila…
articles.content:
As of May 7, there were 794 active cases of COVID-19 in Australia. Only 62 were in hospital.
The situation in New Zealand is similar, with 136 active cases, only two of whom are in hospital.
If we continue on this path, could we eliminate COVID-19 from Aust… [+5465 chars]

articles.title: Trial begins of arthritis drug to treat critical COVID-19 patients - The Age
articles.description: The trial will look into whether the anti-inflammatory can help patients who are experiencing serious lung inflammation from the late stage of the disease.
articles.content:
Professor Barber said the drug worked by inhibiting an immune system molecule known as IL6, which causes inflammation, and also appears to be found in high levels in patients with late-stage COVID-19.
Associate Professor Bridget Barber.
